kk_oop wrote:

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
>  > kk_oop wrote:
>  >
>  > > Hi.  I was running a test suite under JUnit version 3.7.0 through
>  > > XDE/Eclipse version 2.0.1 and I got a null pointer error.  When I
>  > > stepped through the program, I saw that the error occurs right when I
>  > > get a window telling me
>  > > that "org.eclipse.jdt.runner.RemoteTestRunner" type cannot be found.
>  > > Do I need this type?  It does not seem to be in the junit.jar file.
>  >
>  > It sounds like you need it. It's part of the Eclipse JUnit integration.
>  > --
> 
> Do you know where it is supposed to be?  I'm not sure if it's not
> there, or if it is there and Eclipse just isn't seeing it.

There should be some *.jar files in 
<eclipse-root>/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.junit. Just open 'em up and see 
where RemoteTestRunner is, I guess.
--
